a.title: District and Campus Reports & Required Postings
a.span: District and Campus Reports & Required Postings

div.style: border-color: currentcolor currentcolor rgb(79, 129, 189); border-style: none none solid; border-width: medium medium 1pt; padding: 0in 0in 4pt; margin-left: 40px; text-align: center;

p.span: You can spread #COVID19 without knowing you have it. Whether you have symptoms or not, #StayHome. If you have to go out, wear a mask/bandana/scarf, regularly wash your hands, and stay 6 feet apart. We must stay #ApartTogether to slow coronavirus. https://tea.texas.gov/staywell

Hello, this is Mrs.Zeigler from Kress ISD. We miss our students, and hope you are all well. This important message about COVID-19 will help to keep you safe and healthy. The most important thing you can do right now is stay at home! If thats not possible, practice social distancing by staying 6 feet from others. Wash your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds and disinfect frequently touched surfaces such as doorknobs and countertops. Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth, and cover a cough or sneeze with your elbow. If you have symptoms of COVID-19 a fever, dry cough, or shortness of breath, call your doctor. Remember, by staying apart now, we can all be together again faster!
If you need to contact me please call me anytime at 806.774.0631. I am here for you. Mrs. Zeigler
Parents click the link "for students" and "for staff " on the menu to the right for educational resources for kids and used by the teachers.
Schools will remain closed until at least May 4, 2020. However we are prepared to continue our
as well as our meal plan until May 22, 2020 if necessary.

Mandatory participation is required of all students pre-k through 12th grade in the provided educational program regardless of method. The teacher may use digital tools or send home a packet including lessons and homework.
Instructional materials will be picked up on and returned on Mondays. If you are unable to pick up and drop off the packet please call the school to let us know. The high school number is 806.684.2651 and the elementary number is 806.684.2326. We will arrange for the pick and drop off packets and meals if needed.
Attendance is important for students to keep course credits and to be promoted. We will be reporting attendance based on the delivery of instruction and completion of work assigned. Student promotion and graduation will be based on locally determined TEKS mastery and graded work turned in by students.

Meals will be provided for our students much like a drive through as we will not be serving meals in the cafeteria as usual. Meal service will begin Monday, March 30, 2020. All children 18 and under may receive a grab and go meal at no charge. Meals will be available for pick up from the cafeteria side door from 10:00 to 1:00 p.m. on MWF.

span.strong:
Meals will be available each Monday, Wednesday, and Friday (MWF). Each meal will include breakfast and lunch.
On Monday we will be giving out 2 meals--1 for Monday and 1 for Tuesday.
On Wednesday we will be giving out 2 meals-1 for Wednesday and Thursday.
On Friday we will be giving out 3 meals.

p.span: Please stay connected to your school family. The high schools number is 806.684.2651 and the elementary schools number is 806.684.2326.

Kress ISD has a webpage, www.kressonline.net that we will use to communicate specific plans for continuing instruction while our students are at home. We will also use our Facebook groups to post information and announcements. We will post schedules and how-tos as quickly as we can.
This is a rapidly progressing situation that impacts every citizen across the globe. Thank you for your patience and cooperation as we work together under these unprecedented circumstances.
I love this community, the families and the students at Kress ISD. I serve a Mighty God and I am praying for you all daily. We will weather this storm together!

span.strong:
Weekly Schedule for Meals and Instructional Packets
Monday: Meals and Packets picked up and last weeks work turned in. SnackPack4Kids
Wednesday: Meals Pick Up
Friday: Meal Pick Up

span.strong: Additionally, Kress ISD asks the broader community to take the following reasonable precautions to prevent the spread of the illness:

strong.span: Limit movement within the community, especially avoiding crowded placed and maintaining 3 to 6 ft of distance between people (at least an arms length)
If you are moving around in the community, dont congregate in large groups

For those who have traveled to areas with known COVID-19 cases both inside and outside of the country we ask that you self-quarantine and monitor for symptoms. Anyone who have traveled should plan to stay home for two weeks after arriving home.
of COVID-19, call your health care provider for medical advice .

span.strong: Do not leave the house if you are ill, except to access medical care.
